definitions: A digital currency in which transactions are verified and records maintained by a decentralized system using cryptography, rather than by a central authority.

A digital asset designed to work as a medium of exchange wherein individual coin ownership records are stored in a ledger computerized database using strong cryptography to secure transaction records, to control the creation of additional coins, and to verify the transfer of coin ownership.
examples: Many investors are interested in cryptocurrency.
The value of cryptocurrency can be volatile.
